answer: Exam schedules are published on the university website 4 weeks before the exam period begins. Check the academic calendar for specific dates.

questions: what is the full form of SRMCEM?
answer: SRMCEM stands for Shri Ramswaroop Memorial College of Engineering and Management, a premier technical institution in Lucknow.
SRMCEM is located at Tindola, Faizabad Road, Lucknow - 226028, Uttar Pradesh, India.
SRMCEM offers B.Tech (CSE, IT, ECE, ME, CE), MBA, MCA, BBA, BCA, B.Pharm, and other technical programs.
Yes, SRMCEM is approved by AICTE and affiliated to AKTU (Dr. A.P.J. Abdul Kalam Technical University).
Contact: +91-522-2720555, Email: info@srmcem.ac.in, Website: www.srmcem.ac.in
B.Tech specializations: Computer Science, Information Technology, Electronics, Mechanical, and Civil Engineering.

questions: how to get admission in SRMCEM?
answer: Admission is through UPSEE/JEE Main for B.Tech, and UPSEE/CAT/MAT for MBA. Visit admissions.srmcem.ac.in for details.
Approximate annual fees: B.Tech (₹1.2L), MBA (₹1L), B.Pharm (₹90k). Exact fees vary by program - check the prospectus.
Yes, SRMCEM provides separate hostels for boys and girls with modern amenities. Fees approx. ₹60k/year including meals.
Library hours: 8:30 AM to 8:00 PM (Mon-Sat). Sundays and holidays: 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM.
SRMCEM has a placement cell with 80%+ placement rate. Top recruiters: TCS, Wipro, Infosys, Capgemini, and others.
SRMCEM has a 25-acre green campus with modern infrastructure including labs, sports facilities, and auditoriums.
Yes, college buses operate on major routes in Lucknow. Fees approx. ₹15k/year. Route details available at transport office.

questions: what are the documents required for admission?
answer: 10th/12th marksheets, transfer certificate, character certificate, migration certificate, UPSEE rank card (if applicable), and ID proof.
Selected programs at SRMCEM are NBA accredited. The college is also ISO 9001:2015 certified.

questions: what is the student faculty ratio?
answer: SRMCEM maintains a healthy 15:1 student-faculty ratio with qualified professors and industry experts.
Merit-based and need-based scholarships available. UP government scholarships also applicable. Contact accounts office.
State-of-the-art labs: Computer labs with 500+ systems, IoT/robotics lab, language lab, and department-specific technical labs.
Cricket ground, basketball court, badminton courts, table tennis, gymnasium, and annual sports meet.
Formal dress code (shirt/trousers for boys, salwar-kameez/saree for girls). Lab coats for practical sessions.
High-speed wifi across campus with 24/7 availability for academic purposes. Login credentials provided after admission.
Annual fest 'TECHNEX', technical symposiums, hackathons, and cultural programs throughout the year.
Spacious canteen serving hygienic North Indian meals (₹40-60 per meal). Snack counters also available.
Minimum 75% attendance required in each subject. Medical leave applications must be submitted with documents.
Training & Placement cell facilitates summer internships. Students can also approach companies through college MoUs.
Technical clubs (IEEE, CSI), cultural clubs, entrepreneurship cell, NSS, and sports committees.
Nearest landmark: Near CRPF Camp, Tindola. 15km from Lucknow Airport, 12km from Charbagh Railway Station.
First-aid center with nurse available. Tie-ups with nearby hospitals for emergencies. Annual health checkups conducted.
Odd semester: July-Dec, Even semester: Jan-May. Exact dates vary yearly - check college notice board.
Yes, faculty guide research projects. Students can participate in conferences and publish papers through college support.

questions: what is the alumni network like?
answer: Strong alumni network with graduates at Google, Amazon, TCS, L&T, and other top companies. Annual alumni meet conducted.
Strict anti-ragging policy enforced. Zero tolerance - offenders face immediate disciplinary action including expulsion.
Semester pattern with internal assessments (30%) and university exams (70%). Malpractice leads to serious consequences.

questions: how to get TC from SRMCEM?
answer: Submit application to registrar office with no-dues certificate. Processing takes 7-10 working days.
Yes, SBI branch and ATM available within campus. Fee payments can be made through college bank account.
Yes, SRMCEM has 'Innovation & Entrepreneurship Development Center' supporting student startups with mentorship and funding.
50,000+ books, 100+ print journals, 5000+ e-journals through DELNET, and online databases access.
Yes, MoUs with universities in UK, Germany and Australia for student/faculty exchange programs.
As per AKTU norms - 90% refund before session starts, reducing progressively. No refund after 1 month of commencement.
University results at aktu.ac.in. Internal assessments displayed on college notice boards and ERP portal.
Submit written complaint to HOD or use suggestion boxes across campus. Online grievance portal also available.
Yes, department-wise visits to companies like HAL, BHEL, and IT parks organized every semester.

questions: what are the computer lab specs?
answer: 500+ systems with i5 processors, 8GB RAM, licensed software. 24/7 access to final year project students.
Possible only after 1st year based on merit and seat availability, as per AKTU regulations.
Well-equipped gym with trainer guidance available mornings and evenings. Separate timings for boys and girls.
Submit leave application to class coordinator in advance (except emergencies). Medical leave requires doctor's certificate.

questions: how to do final year project?
answer: Groups of 3-4 students, faculty guide allocation in 7th sem. Regular reviews and final viva voce examination.

Regular workshops on AI/ML, IoT, soft skills, and aptitude training. Certification courses available through Coursera.
Access through college library portal using your enrollment ID. Includes e-books, NPTEL videos, and research papers.

questions: what are the seminar hall facilities?
answer: 500-seat AC auditorium with modern AV systems. 4 seminar halls with 100-150 capacity each for departmental events.
Active NSS unit organizing blood donation camps, village adoption programs. NCC available as optional subject.
Approx. ₹15,000/year for college buses covering major routes in Lucknow. Monthly passes also available.

questions: how to get duplicate ID card?
answer: Submit application to admin office with ₹500 fee and police complaint copy (if lost). Ready in 3 working days.
Designated parking for students (free for cycles, ₹100/month for bikes, ₹300/month for cars). Security guarded.
Monthly e-newsletter 'SRMCEM Chronicle' sent to registered emails. Follow official social media pages for updates.

questions: what are the rules for outpass?
answer: Hostel students need warden approval for outpass. Day scholars don't require outpass during college hours.

questions: what companies visit SRMCEM for placements?
answer: Top recruiters: TCS, Wipro, Infosys, Capgemini, Accenture, Tech Mahindra, L&T Infotech, HCL, IBM, and many more IT/engineering firms.

questions: what is the average package at SRMCEM?
answer: Average package: ₹4.5 LPA for B.Tech, ₹5 LPA for MBA. Highest package goes up to ₹12-15 LPA for exceptional candidates.
Focus on: 1) Core technical concepts 2) Aptitude practice 3) Coding skills (HackerRank/LeetCode) 4) Mock interviews 5) Soft skills training provided by T&P cell.

Placement season starts from July for final year students. Mass recruiters visit July-Dec, core companies Jan-Mar. Pre-placement talks begin in 3rd year itself.
Average placement rate: 80-85% for eligible students (maintaining 60%+ academics and no active backlogs). Computer Science branch has 90%+ placement rate.
Yes! Comprehensive training includes: 1) Aptitude classes 2) Technical workshops 3) Mock GD/PI 4) Resume building 5) HR interview skills - starts from 3rd year.

questions: can I get off-campus placement help?
answer: T&P cell provides: 1) Company referral letters 2) Recommendation letters 3) Interview preparation 4) Test series even for off-campus opportunities.

questions: what is the dress code for placements?
answer: Formal attire compulsory: For boys - Suit/Formal shirt+tie. For girls - Formal suit/saree. Avoid casuals during placement drives.

questions: how many students placed last year?
